      • instances

        public int instances
        For instanced rendering. Use on things like particle systems (also use abstractObjectPool for those too, they're awesome).

      • loadOBJ_raw

        public java.util.ArrayList<Tri> loadOBJ_raw(java.io.InputStream f)
                                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                            java.io.IOException
        Load OBJ file with no setup whatsoever. Do not use.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException

      • loadOBJ

        public GObject loadOBJ(java.lang.String filename)
        Load an obj file. It'll look for a texture with the same name (file extension is added automatically: do not put ".obj" at the end.)

      • loadOBJ

        public GObject loadOBJ(java.lang.String filename,
                       java.lang.String texname)
        Load an obj file with a custom texture. Filename must not have a file extension, texname must have one.

      • loadTexture

        public void loadTexture(java.lang.String texname)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Load texture manually. Must have file extension. Will only succeed if vmap.tex.colorLoaded is true.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • lock

        public void lock()
        Tri locking is so that we don't need to reinitialize buffers like an idiot on every frame. Having a finite list of triangles lets us optimize our buffer creation strategies.

      • rayTest_closest

        public Tri rayTest_closest(javax.vecmath.Vector3f a,
                           javax.vecmath.Vector3f b,
                           com.bulletphysics.linearmath.Transform tr)
        If a segment from a to b hits this GObject transformed by transform tr, get the closest tri that gets hit to a.

      • rayTest_distance

        public float rayTest_distance(javax.vecmath.Vector3f a,
                              javax.vecmath.Vector3f b,
                              com.bulletphysics.linearmath.Transform tr)
        If a ray from a to b hits this GObject transformed by transform tr, get the closest distance along that ray.

      • rayTest_list

        public java.util.ArrayList<Tri> rayTest_list(javax.vecmath.Vector3f a,
                                             javax.vecmath.Vector3f b,
                                             com.bulletphysics.linearmath.Transform tr)
        If a segment from a to b hits this GObject transformed by transform tr, get a list of tris it hits.

      • rayTest

        public boolean rayTest(javax.vecmath.Vector3f a,
                       javax.vecmath.Vector3f b,
                       com.bulletphysics.linearmath.Transform tr)
        If a segment from a to b hits this GObject transformed by transform tr.

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        Copy all the needed data GPU-side.

      • render_raw

        public void render_raw()
        Draw the triangles with no setup whatsoever. Don't use.
